alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued December 14 at 1:57AM MST until December 15 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM MST /9 AM CST/ TO 8 PM MST /9 PM CST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds of 35 to 50 mph with gusts up to 70 mph in the morning through very early afternoon, shifting to the west and northwest with gusts up to 60 mph from early afternoon through sunset. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Kansas, east central and northeast Colorado and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...From 8 AM MST /9 AM CST/ to 8 PM MST /9 PM CST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Wind of this magnitude may down trees, power lines, and damage property. High winds may also create dangerous travel conditions, especially on high speed limit, high traffic routes such as Interstate 70. Reduced visibilities associated with blowing dust may exacerbate already difficult travel conditions and cause very poor air quality. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This system will not develop until early Wednesday morning and, when it does develop, it will do so very near or directly over the Tri-State area. As a result, a fair amount of uncertainty persists with regard to both the magnitude and location of the strongest winds. Hurricane force wind gusts (at least 75 mph) are possible.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County
